title: White House details new 'kid-friendly' vaccination, education plan
author: STEPHEN LOIACONI; Sinclair Broadcast Group
description: The Biden administration outlined its plans Wednesday for providing "convenient, easily accessible, and free" COVID-19 vaccination for children if shots for ages 5 to 11 are authorized in the coming weeks. "Kids have different needs than adults and our operational planning is geared to meet those specific needs, including by offering vaccinations in settings that parents and kids are familiar with and trust," said White House COVID-19 task force coordinator Jeffrey Zeints.
cleaned_text: White House details new 'kid-friendly' vaccination, education plan by STEPHEN LOIACONI, Sinclair Broadcast Group FILE - In this May 19, 2021 file photo, Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine doses are prepared for members of the community 12 years and up, at a clinic held by Community of Hope, outside the Washington School for Girls in southeast Washington. Kids aged 5 to 11 will soon be able to get a COVID-19 shot at their pediatrician's office, local pharmacy and potentially even their school. The White House is detailing plans Wednesday for the expected authorization of the Pfizer shot for younger children in a matter of weeks. (AP Photo/Jacquelyn Martin, file)
